posts.post_content:
Level abilities are triggered by the level so Necrotic Ooze can't get them (although it can put level counters on itself, they're useless).  
  
Focused on Standard lets see what's available. Most this is too slow or takes too many cards to be competitive...  
  
[Fauna Shaman](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fauna Shaman) is a perfect fit. Not only can it help get the critters we want to graveyard, but the Ooze can learn her ability.  
  
[Gigantomancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gigantomancer) and [Spikeshot Elder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spikeshot Elder) should end the game pretty quickly at 7 damage for 2RR then attack.  
[Spawnsire of Ulamog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spawnsire of Ulamog) gives 2 tokens for 4 that can be sacced for 1. With a Training Ground, that gets interesting quickly. At the very least, you can build up mana and use them as immediately replaced (using the mana from saccing them) chump blockers.  
  
[Sphinx of the Magosi](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sphinx of the Magosi) for counters and draw...for U with [Training Grounds](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Training Grounds).  
[Carnifex Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Carnifex Demon) if we can figure out ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
From the comprehensive rules PDF.  
  
*201.4b If an ability of an object refers to that object by name, and an object with a different name  
gains that ability, all instances of the first name in the gained ability should be treated as the  
second name.*  
  
So if you have a myr propagator in the graveyard and a necrotic ooze in play, the ability gained by the ooze should for all intents and purposes read,   
  
3, Tap: Put a token that's a copy of *necrotic ooze* onto the battlefield.  
  
So... Many.... Combos.... .!. (head explodes).
posts.html:
From the comprehensive rules PDF.

201.4b If an ability of an object refers to that object by name, and an object with a different name
gains that ability, all instances of the first name in the gained ability should be treated as the
second name.

So if you have a myr propagator in the graveyard and a necrotic ooze in play, the ability gained by the ooze should for all intents and purposes read,

3, Tap: Put a token that's a copy of necrotic ooze onto the battlefield.

So... Many.... Combos.... .!. (head explodes).

Posted By: roguepariah (10/1/2010 3:24:28 AM)
Rating:

@abmaynar

Reassembling Skeleton 's ability can only be activated while it's in the graveyard. Necrotic Ooze's static ability only works on the battlefield. At no point could Necrotic Ooze have the ability and activate it, too.

Even if you could activate it from the battlefield, rule 400.7 states that the Necrotic Ooze whose ability you activated on the battlefield is not the same Necrotic Ooze that appears in the graveyard, even if it's the same card. The ability would resolve, search for the Necrotic Ooze that was on the battlefield, and do nothing since that Necrotic Ooze has ceased to exist.

@RentNalo-MasterTS
Landfall abilities are almost always triggered abilities. Necrotic Ooze does not gain them.

posts.post_content:
Here's a question:  
  
How does this card interact with flip cards in graveyards such as [Nezumi Graverobber](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nezumi Graverobber), [Jushi Apprentice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jushi Apprentice), and [Budoka Gardener](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Budoka Gardener)?  
  
If you were to activate the ability of one of those cards in a graveyard and then the condition to flip that permanent was met, would Necrotic Ooze get flipped? Is it even possible to flip it? And furthermore, if it was to get flipped, would it gain the activated abilities of the flipped half of the card ([Nighteyes the Desecrator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nighteyes the Desecrator), [Tomoya the Revealer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tomoya the Revealer), [Dokai, Weaver of Life](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dokai, Weaver of Life))?
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
It was funny before Wizards revised the oracle text on [Phyrexian Devourer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Devourer) to watch people make Necrotic Ooze a 107/107 creature on the board on turn two. (Combo: turn one, play [Entomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Entomb) for Devourer; turn 2 play [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual) and Necrotic Ooze; toss forty cards or so off the top of the library). Even ignoring the fact that Survival of the Fittest could find all the combo components for you, that combo was *obscene*. The Survival of the Fittest build with [Badlands](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Badlands) could even put [Anger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Anger) in the graveyard for an alpha strike. Crazy.  
  
There've been more powerful two-card combos in Magic ([Flash](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flash) + [Protean Hulk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Protean Hulk), [Fastbond](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fastbond) + [Fireball](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fireball) or whatever), but I can't think of any two-card combo that screamed "BROKEN" more plainly than Ooze + Devourer.  
  
Thank goodness for Oracle text-revision fixes. I didn't want to se... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
It was funny before Wizards revised the oracle text on Phyrexian Devourer to watch people make Necrotic Ooze a 107/107 creature on the board on turn two. (Combo: turn one, play Entomb for Devourer; turn 2 play Dark Ritual and Necrotic Ooze; toss forty cards or so off the top of the library). Even ignoring the fact that Survival of the Fittest could find all the combo components for you, that combo was obscene. The Survival of the Fittest build with Badlands could even put Anger in the graveyard for an alpha strike. Crazy.

There've been more powerful two-card combos in Magic (Flash + Protean Hulk, Fastbond + Fireball or whatever), but I can't think of any two-card combo that screamed "BROKEN" more plainly than Ooze + Devourer.

Thank goodness for Oracle text-revision fixes. I didn't want to se... (see all)
